members.description: These are all the "native" node properties

property.name: Parent
property.description: A reference to the node's parent

property.name: Id
property.description: The id of the node in Umbraco

property.name: TemplateId
property.description: If a template has been assigned, its id is returned here.

property.name: Url
property.description: The absolute URL (e.g. /my/page/about-url/) of the content item. Whenever you need to link to a page, this is what you should use.
property.note: If the config setting <useDomainPrefixes> in umbracoSetting.config is true, this will return a full URL with protocol, hostname & port etc.

description.p: A URL-safe version of the node's name, e.g. for a document named About Us the UrlName property would be generated as about-us.
Also good for anchor links to various sections on a page (see code example)

property.name: DocumentTypeAlias
property.description: Returns the alias of the Document Type used by this content item.

property.name: Path
property.description: A CSV string of the ids of the nodes in the ancestor axis, e.g.: "-1,1060,2590"

function.name: GetTemplateAlias
function.description: The alias of the assigned template (if any).

members.description: The IsHelper methods are a set of extension methods for IPublishedContent to help perform quick conditional queries against IPublishedContent nodes in a collection. They can all return a simple boolean, or one of two supplied strings, depending on the result of the comparison. Leaving the valueIfFalse argument out is equivalent to supplying an empty string, which is what will be returned if the condition evaluates to false.

function.name: IsFirst
function.description: Test if the current node is first in the collection.

function.name: IsNotFirst
function.description: Test if the current node is not the first in the collection

function.name: IsLast
function.description: Test if the current node is last in the collection

function.name: IsNotLast
function.description: Test if the current node is not the last item in the collection

function.name: IsPosition
function.description: Test if the current node is at the specified index in the collection

function.name: IsNotPosition
function.description: Test if the current node is not at the specified index in the collection

function.name: IsModZero
function.description: Test if the current node's position is evenly divisible by a given number

function.name: IsNotModZero
function.description: Test if the current node's position is not evenly divisible by a given number

function.name: IsEven
function.description: Test if the current node's position is even

function.name: IsOdd
function.description: Test if the current node's position is odd

function.name: IsEqual
function.description: Test if the current node in the iteration is equal (by Id) to another node

function.name: IsDescendant
function.description: Test if the current node in the iteration is a descendant of another node

function.name: IsDescendantOrSelf
function.description: Test if the current node in the iteration is the same as, or a descendant of, another node

function.name: IsAncestor
function.description: Test if the current node in the iteration is an ancestor of another node

function.name: IsAncestorOrSelf
function.description: Test if the current node in the iteration is the same as, or an ancestor of, another node

members.description: These are used for walking up/down the tree from any other node you might be on. They all return a single IPublishedContent node.

function.name: Parent<T>
function.description: Returns the parent if it has the specific type T, otherwise null.

function.name: Sibling
function.note: Obsolete - use FollowingSibling or PrecedingSibling instead.

function.name: HasProperty
function.description: Returns a boolean value representing if the IPublishedContent has a property with the specified alias.

function.name: HasValue
function.description: Returns a boolean value representing if the IPublishedContent property has had a value set.

function.name: IsNull
function.description: Returns a boolean value representing if the IPublishedContent property is Null.

function.name: IsVisible
function.note: This function requires a custom property with the alias umbracoNaviHide to work!

function.name: Site
function.description: Gets the ancestor at level 1
function.note: In v8 this will be renamed to .Root()

function.name: GetCulture
function.description: Gets the culture that would be used to render the content, within the context of a specified current request.

members.description: When collecting nodes for a navigation or a listview, these come in very handy. They all work on and return a collection, so can can be chained for very effective results.

function.name: Where
function.description: Provides a way to filter a collection of nodes, by using a lambda function that returns true if the node should be included and false if not.

function.name: RandomOrder
function.description: Randomizes a collection's items. Combine with Take or FirstOrDefault to get a random piece of content to display somewhere.

members.description: These are available on the @Umbraco object inside the template.

function.name: If
function.description: Returns one of two values depending on the result of a test.

function.name: Truncate
function.description: Truncates a string to a given length and can add an ellipsis (…) at the end. The method checks for open HTML tags, and makes sure to close them.

function.name: TruncateByWords
function.description: Truncates a string to a given amount of words and can add an ellipsis (…) at the end. The method checks for open HTML tags, and makes sure to close them.

function.name: Coalesce
function.description: Returns the first non-null value in the list of arguments.

function.name: Concatenate
function.description: Returns all of its arguments concatenated into a single string.

function.name: Join
function.description: Returns all of its arguments joined with a specific separator between each of them.

function.name: StripHTML
function.description: Strips HTML tags from a given string, leaving the contents of the tags in place. If no tags are specified, all HTML tags are stripped.

function.name: ReplaceLineBreaksForHtml
function.description:
Replace linebreaks with HTML
tags.

function.name: CreateHash
function.description: Generates a hash based on the text string passed in. This method will detect the security requirements (is FIPS enabled) and return an appropriate hash.

function.name: GetDictionaryValue
function.description: Returns the dictionary value for the specified key. You can specify an altText fallback value to be returned if the dictionary has no value for key.
